alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Fulton; Henry; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:49PM EDT until April 01 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern De Kalb County in northeastern Indiana... Northern Defiance County in northwestern Ohio... Northwestern Henry County in northwestern Ohio... Williams County in northwestern Ohio... Fulton County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 1148 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Edgerton In Williams County to near Hicksville, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bryan, Wauseon, Archbold, Montpelier, Swanton, Hicksville, Butler, Delta, Edgerton, West Unity, Stryker, Fayette, Edon, St. Joe, Holiday City, Edgerton In Williams County, West Jefferson, Pulaski, Farmer and Metamora. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 48. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northeastern Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northeastern Indiana.
